title: American Horror Stories Episode 7 Review "Game Over" The WORST AHS Episode Ever?
author: Reel Talk
comment: Michelle specifically made a video game in which the main character's boyfriend is a two, pump chump in, what I can only imagine, is a video game cut scene. That is all.

After giving "Game Over" some thought, I've come to the conclusion that this is purely Ryan Murphy and Brad Falchuk mocking the fans and sending a message. The mess of this episode is inexcusable otherwise. It is their way of saying that they are aware of the heavy criticism that the show has received (specially for the first two episodes), but they are still the ones controlling the narrative; they will return to whatever location they wish to (pretending to burn down MH just confirms this), regardless if fans are sick of them or not; they will continue hiring nepotism kids, even if they are not talented; they will do whatever they want because they simply can, and we will continue to watch it. "Game Over" is the worst thing I have ever seen on television. And will I come back for season 2? Yes, I will.
American Horror Story has finally turned into Glee, progressively in downward trajectory.
The most confusing episode so far , at the end I was just done lol .

Why does Scarlet only visit Ruby in the Murder House on Halloween? Can’t she just go in any day and see her? Ruby can only go out on Halloween, and there’s nothing stopping Scarlet from going inside any other day…….
description:
American Horror Stories Episode 7 Review "Game Over!" So, was this one of the strangest episodes ever? Let's discuss!

Deadass Serious:
